<jggilbert@...> writes:

> Darcy,
> The first one is Hiroyuki with a kao.  There are several makers listed
> with that name.

Supposing this is not gimei for some reason, I guess the kao would help
tell them apart? There is an overall feeling of newness to this as well,
so I would think that the maker would be working in the 1800s. 

> The second is Nara Toshi (Naga?) followed by a kao.  I'm not seeing
> the second character on the left very well, but if you're seeing it as
> the other "toshi," that kanji can also be read Naga and there are a
> number of makers signing that way including the Nara Toshinaga of
> sansaku fame.

Robertson character 187 is the one, most definitely and beyond a doubt
in person. I couldn't get it to stand out very well on the scan, I've
been sorting out various things since coming back from Japan so I didn't
put a lot of effort into getting a good clear one.

Reading it as naga is news to me though, thanks for the tip, I will do
some digging. I don't have much in the way of documentation for kodogu,
but I saw something for a Toshinaga, none for Hiroyuki though.

Thanks very much!

- darcy
